Bush's remarks criticized by S. Korean national assemblymen
articles.content:
Bush's remarks criticized by S. Korean national assemblymen
    Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Six national assemblymen from the ruling and opposition parties visited the U.S. embassy in Seoul on Feb. 6 and handed it a protest letter to the effect that Bush's unilateral harsh remarks against the north are doing serious harm to the main framework of peace and stability on the Korean peninsula, according to Seoul-based radio No. 1.
 They urged the U.S. to peacefully improve the DPRK-U.S. relations strained by Bush's harsh remarks through dialogue at an early date.    
 Meanwhile, they submitted to the "national assembly" a resolution, in which they clarified their stand on Bush's hard-line policy.

Meetings to congratulate sun of 21st century to take place in DPRK
articles.content:
Meetings to congratulate sun of 21st century to take place in DPRK
    Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- "Meetings to Congratulate the Sun of the 21st Century" will be held in the area of the secret camp on mt. Paektu and in Pyongyang on the initiative of the participants in the special meeting of the Latin American and Caribbean Regional Committee to Support the Reunification of Korea held in Medellin, Colombia, in February last year.
 The meetings to be attended by a large number of foreign friends will be international assemblies common to humankind highly praising and venerating leader Kim Jong Il as the great sun of the 21st century.

Floral basket and gift to Kim Jong Il from C.C., CPC
articles.content:
Floral basket and gift to Kim Jong Il from C.C., CPC
    Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket and a gift by the central committee of the Communist Party of China in the run-up to his birthday.
 The floral basket and gift were conveyed to Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the central committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, by Chinese ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe yesterday.
